Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.actor

Class ActiveActor

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.actor.ActiveActor
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
FighterPlane, Projectile
public abstract class ActiveActor extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView
The ActiveActor class represents an actor in a game or simulation that can move and be destroyed. It extends the ImageView class to display an image and provides methods for movement and state management. This class is abstract and requires subclasses to implement the update and takeDamage methods.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ActiveActor

      public ActiveActor(String imageName, int imageHeight, double initialXPos, double initialYPos)
      Constructs an ActiveActor with the specified image, position, and height.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the name of the image file to be used for the actor
      imageHeight - the height of the image
      initialXPos - the initial X position of the actor
      initialYPos - the initial Y position of the actor

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(double deltaX, double deltaY)
      Moves the actor by the specified delta values in the X and Y directions.
      Parameters:
      deltaX - the change in the X direction
      deltaY - the change in the Y direction

    • moveHorizontally

      protected void moveHorizontally(double horizontalMove)
      Moves the actor horizontally by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      horizontalMove - the distance to move the actor horizontally. Positive values move the actor to the right, and negative values move the actor to the left.

    • moveVertically

      protected void moveVertically(double verticalMove)
      Moves the actor vertically by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      verticalMove - the amount to move the actor vertically. Positive values move the actor downwards, while negative values move the actor upwards.

    • getImageHeight

      public int getImageHeight()
      Returns the height of the image associated with this actor.
      Returns:
      the height of the image in pixels

    • update

      public abstract void update(long now)
      Updates the actor.
      Parameters:
      now - The current time.

    • takeDamage

      public abstract boolean takeDamage()
      Abstract method to handle the actor taking damage. Implementations of this method should define the specific behavior when the actor takes damage, such as reducing health points.
      Returns:
      true if the actor successfully takes damage, false otherwise.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Marks the actor as destroyed by setting the isDestroyed flag to true.

    • isDestroyed

      public boolean isDestroyed()
      Checks if the actor is destroyed.
      Returns:
      True if destroyed, else false.
